'''Agnès Marin''' ({{Birth date|1997|11|26}} – November 11, 2011) was a 13-year-old girl who was murdered on November 11, 2011 in Chambon-sur-Lignon, France. The murder was committed by 17 year-old Mathieu Moulinas, who at the time was on parole while awaiting trial for rape of another girl.
== Early life == Agnès Marin was born to Paola and Frederic Marin. According to a close friend, she was a good student who was interested in becoming a filmmaker.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cornevin|first=Christophe|title=Murder of Agnes: "We heard two loud cries"|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/actualite-france/2011/11/20/01016-20111120ARTFIG00174-meutre-d-agnes-un-collegien-temoigne.php|work=Le Figaro|accessdate=13 May 2014|language=French}}</ref> Her parents had enrolled her at the ''Cévenolles'' boarding school in ''4th grade''<ref group="Note">The French equivalent of the Eighth grade in the U.S.</ref> after being exposed to negative influences including [[marijuana]] at her former junior high school. She was [[Burial|buried]] on her would-be 14th [[birthday]], November 26, 2011.
== Murder == On November 11, 2011, in [[Le Chambon-sur-Lignon|Chambon-sur-Lignon]], in the département of [[Haute-Loire]], Agnès Marin,<ref group="Note">Even through juvenile victims' names should not be released as stipulated by French law, hers was released by her family.</ref> a 13-year-old student at [[Le Collège-Lycée Cévenol International|''Les Cévenoles'' Boarding School]], went with Mathieu Moulinas, another student,<ref group="Note">Although French law is forbidden to reveal any information enabling to name a minor offender, his last name leaked to the press as "Moulinas"</ref> who was nearly 18 at the time, to look for [[Psilocybin mushroom|hallucinogenic mushrooms]] in a forest. Once there, Moulinas proceeded to [[rape]] and [[stabbed|stab]] Agnès 17 times before finally burning her body with petrol that he had brought to the site previously.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|title = France in shock over rape and murder of 13-year old girl|date = November 21, 2011|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/france/8904642/France-in-shock-over-rape-and-murder-of-13-year-old-girl.html|last = Samuel|first = Henry|work = [[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|accessdate = November 7, 2013}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|title = French girl Agnes Marin raped and killed by 17-year-old|date = November 22, 2011|url = http://www.heraldsun.com.au/archive/news/french-girl-agnes-marin-was-raped-and-burned-by-17-year-old/story-e6frf7lf-1226202288756|agency = [[Agence France-Presse]]|accessdate = November 9, 2013|newspaper = [[Herald Sun]]}}</ref>
==Trial== At his trial before the ''[[Cour d'assises|Cour d'assises des mineurs]]''<ref group="Note">Court for juvenile offenders committing ''crimes'' (offences punished by at least 10 years in prison)</ref> that began on June 18, 2013 and was held ''[[in camera]]'' for the most part at the request of Salomé F. in spite of the Marins' wishes and during which Mathieu recognized his guilt, the prosecutor criticized the numerous failings of the institutions and asked the jury to not grant the benefit of minority to Moulinas,<ref group="Note">The ''excuse de minorité'' (see {{Interlanguage link multi|Youth justice in France|fr|3=Justice des mineurs en France}}) in French law the means the maximum sentence for a minor is divided by two, so the maximum is reduced to 20 years for life-eligible crimes.</ref> instead asking for a 30-year sentence and [[civil commitment]], taking into account the fact Moulinas had mental problems.<ref>{{Cite news|title = Haute-Loire - Meurtre d'Agnès : "Un crime exceptionnel, avec un accusé exceptionnel"|date = June 28, 2013|url = http://www.lepoint.fr/societe/meurtre-d-agnes-30-ans-de-reclusion-criminelle-requis-contre-matthieu-28-06-2013-1686928_23.php|last = Colonna d'Istria|first = Geneviève|newspaper = [[Le Point]]|accessdate = November 8, 2013|language = fr}}</ref>
On June 28, 2013, Moulinas was sentenced to [[life imprisonment]], a sentence which had not been met against a juvenile since [[Patrick Dils]] in 1989 (who was subsequently exonerated in 2002.).<ref>{{Cite news|title = French minor given life sentence over rape of 13 year old girl|date = June 30, 2013|url = http://www.english.rfi.fr/france/20130630-french-minor-given-life-sentence-over-rape-13-year-old-girl|newspaper = [[Radio France International]]|accessdate = November 1, 2013|type = radio|department = Europe}}</ref> His [[lawyer]]s [[appeal]]ed the sentence the next day.<ref>{{Cite news|title = Meurtre d'Agnès Marin: les avocates de Matthieu font appel|date = June 29, 2013|url = http://www.liberation.fr/societe/2013/06/29/meurtre-d-agnes-marin-les-avocates-de-matthieu-font-appel_914662|last = |first = |newspaper = [[Libération]]|agency = [[Agence France-Presse]]|accessdate = November 9, 2013|language = fr}}</ref>
=== Controversies === The murder was committed during a time when the French public was debating juvenile criminality and recidivism among offenders.{{citation needed|date=January 2014}}
Some in France criticized the several different failures of the judicial system, whether by freeing such a suspect after three months of remand and putting him in a [[Co-educational|co-ed]] [[boarding school]] or the lack of candor of Moulinas's judicial supervisor about Moulinas's near-expulsion for typing "[[Child pornography|pedo sex]]" in a search engine.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":3" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|title = Autopsie d'un drame|date = June 20, 2012|url = http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2012/06/20/autopsie-d-un-drame_1721770_3224.html|last = Davet|first = Gérard|work = [[Le Monde]]|accessdate = November 7, 2013|location = France|trans-title=Autopsy of a drama|language = fr}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite news|title = Un proche de la 1ère victime de l'agresseur d'Agnès parle|date = November 22, 2011|url = http://www.lefigaro.fr/actualite-france/2011/11/22/01016-20111122ARTFIG00402-un-proche-de-la-1ere-victime-de-l-agresseur-d-agnes-parle.php|last = Amadeo|first = Fabrice|accessdate = November 8, 2011|newspaper =[[Le Figaro]]|language = fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title = France Calls for Reform After Murder of Girl, 13|date = November 23, 2011|url = http://plus.lefigaro.fr/note/france-calls-for-reform-after-murder-of-girl-13-20111123-607566|work =[[Le Figaro]]|accessdate = November 8, 2013|department = Le Figaro in English|location = France}}</ref>
While the prosecution argued the school was aware Moulinas was charged for rape, the school stated they were not aware of the exact reason why he was under investigation. His father said he alluded his son was under investigation for a sexual offense.<ref name=":3" /> However, the father of the victim claims that the school was aware that Moulinas had problems involving "sexual acts of aggression." <ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-15828349|title = School murder scandal shocks France |last = |first = |date = November 22, 2011|work = Le Monde|accessdate = October 10, 2014|trans-title = School murder scandal shocks France }}</ref>
=== Appeal === On {{date|2014-10-10|mdy}}, his life sentence was confirmed by the Appeal Assize Court, ending any possibility of the revision of the rulings on the facts.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2014/10/10/l-assassin-d-agnes-marin-condamne-a-la-reclusion-a-perpetuite-en-appel_4504477_3224.html|title = Assassinat d'Agnès Marin : Matthieu M. condamné à la réclusion à perpétuité en appel|last = |first = |date = October 10, 2014|work = Le Monde|accessdate = October 10, 2014|language = fr|trans-title = Murder of Agnès Marin : Matthieu M. sentenced to life after appealing}}</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Nadja Benaissa |image = Nadja von den No Angels.jpg |caption = Benaissa in 2008 |birth_name = Nadja Benaissa |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|04|26|df=yes}} |occupation = {{flatlist| *[[Singer-songwriter]] *[[television personality]] *[[actress]] *[[model (profession)|model]] }} |years_active = 2000–2013
2015 | children = 1 |label_name = [[Universal Records|Universal Urban]] |website = [http://nadjabenaissa.de NadjaBenaissa.de] |Influences = }} '''Nadja Benaissa''' (born 26 April 1982) is a German recording artist, television personality, and occasional actress. She rose to fame in late 2000 when she auditioned for the [[reality television]] show ''[[Popstars (Germany)|Popstars]]'' on [[RTL II]]. The programme announced that Benaissa had won a place as a member of the [[girl group|all-female]] pop band [[No Angels]]. The group has achieved massive success and went on to become the "biggest-selling German [[All female band|girlband]] to date". After a series of commercially successful releases with the group, Benaissa released her solo debut album ''[[Schritt für Schritt]]'' in 2006. The semi-autobiographical album was recorded entirely in [[German language|German]], taking Benaissa's work further into [[soul music|soul]], [[R&B music|R&B]] and [[jazz music]],{{cite web|work=SoulSite.de |title=Interview :: Nadja Benaissa – Was für die Seele gut ist :: 01.02.2006 |url=http://www.soulsite.de/interviews/interview.shtml?id=20 |language=German|accessdate=17 January 2008}} but enjoyed moderate commercial success. In February 2010, she was charged with causing bodily harm by [[Law enforcement in Germany|German police]] for having [[unprotected sex]] with three men between 2004 and 2006, without informing them she was [[HIV]]-positive.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/7998981.stm|title=German star arrested in HIV case|work=BBC News|date=14 April 2009|accessdate=14 April 2009}}[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8512933.stm "German girl band star charged in HIV case"]. BBC News. 12 February 2010 In August of that same year, she was found guilty of hiding her HIV status from sexual partners and was given a two-year suspended sentence and 300 hours of community service. In September 2010, Nadja Benaissa officially left the band due to private reasons, leaving the No Angels as a trio.{{cite web|first=Nadja|last=Benaissa|title=Offizielle Bekanntmachung auf meiner Seite...|url=http://www.myspace.com/nadjabenaissa|publisher=[[MySpace]]|accessdate=7 September 2010|language=German}} == Early life == Benaissa is the second child born to a [[Moroccan people|Moroccan]] father, Muhamed Benaissa,{{cite web|first=Hannah|last=Booth|title='I knew I was HIV positive'|work=[[The Guardian]]|url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2011/mar/19/nadja-benaissa-interview-hiv-positive|date=19 March 2011|accessdate=22 November 2007}} and a mother of mixed [[Serbs|Serbian]] and [[Germans|German]] ethnicity with German citizenship, Sabina.{{cite news|last=Moore|first=Tristana|url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1891838,00.html|title=In Germany, No Angels Star Nadja Benaissa Faces HIV Charges|work=TIME|date=16 April 2009|accessdate=17 August 2010}} Raised alongside her three years older brother Amin,{{cite web|title=Article about German Muslims: ''Kümmeltürke oder Terrorist?''|work=[[Der Spiegel]] Spezial Nr. 2/2008|url=http://wissen.spiegel.de/wissen/image/show.html?did=56323064&aref=image036/2008/03/24/ROSPC200800200440047.PDF|language=German|accessdate=25 March 2008|format=PDF|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090420032242/http://wissen.spiegel.de/wissen/image/show.html?did=56323064&aref=image036%2F2008%2F03%2F24%2FROSPC200800200440047.PDF|archivedate=20 April 2009|df=}} she spent much of her childhood in [[Langen, Hesse|Langen]], [[Hesse]], where her parents worked in the catering business, and she attended the Geschwister-Scholl-Schule.{{cite web|title=Der Angel, Aids und die Angst|work=[[Bild]]|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/unterhaltung/leute/2009/04/19/no-angels-star-nadja/der-engel-aids-und-die-angst.html|language=German|date=19 April 2009|accessdate=19 April 2009}} At the age of nine, Benaissa began playing instruments, learning the [[piano]] and the [[flute]].{{cite web|title=''ZIBB'' report|work=RBB-Online|url=http://www.rbb-online.de/_/zibb/beitrag_jsp/key=4232139.html |language=German|accessdate=30 December 2007}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Her early musical interest grew after having auditioned and won a role in the school stage musical ''[[Tabaluga]]'' during her first year at the [[Dreieich|Dreieich-Schule-Langen]]. In her early teenage years, she began writing songs, and at the age of 13 Benaissa started performing in several [[cover band]]s within the [[Frankfurt am Main]] area, eventually winning the second place at ''[[Jugend musiziert]]'', a supraregional music contest for youths. On 25 October 1999, at the age of 17, Benaissa gave birth to her daughter Leila Jamila, an event which she describes as "the proudest moment of [her] life". Although Benaissa and her boyfriend ended their relationship, Benaissa began attending evening classes in pursuit of her [[Realschulabschluss]] school certificate. == Career == === 2000–2003: Breakthrough with No Angels === {{Main|No Angels}} In mid-2000, Benaissa, along with thousands of other women, applied for the debut installment of the German reality television program ''[[Popstars]]'', a talent show looking to put together an [[all-female band]]. Sailing through the selection process, judges [[Simone Angel]], Rainer Moslener and Mario M. Mendryzcki were generally impressed by her performances, which earned her a position in the top ten finalists despite her struggle with dancing choreography. During a special episode in November 2000, jury member Angel eventually disclosed that Benaissa had been selected to become part of the final five-member girl group [[No Angels]]. Initially hesitant about signing a recording contract which would force her to leave her baby daughter with her parents, the show's producers remained persuasive and Benaissa eventually agreed on joining the band. [[File:No Angels.jpg|thumb|upight|left|[[No Angels]] performing on-stage at the [[Kiel|Kieler Woche]] on 27 June 2008.]] With the final five members of the band in place, ''Popstars'' continued tracking the development and struggles of the group who left homes to move into a shared flat near [[Munich]], [[Bavaria]]. However, it took another four months until the band released their debut single "[[Daylight in Your Eyes]]", which would subsequently appear on the band's debut album ''[[Elle'ments]]'' (2001). Both the single and the album became an unexpected but record-breaking success, when both instantly entered the top position on the Austrian, German and Swiss ''[[Media Control Charts|Media Control]]'' singles, albums and airplay charts, giving No Angels one of the most successful debuts in years.{{cite web|title=Biografie » No Angels|work=Chart-King|url=http://www.chart-king.de/include.php?path=content/news.php&contentid=13098|language=German|accessdate=31 January 2007}} Suffering from the separation from her daughter, Benaissa [[Burnout (psychology)|burned out]] within months, a subject on which she later commented: {{quote|"I was completely unprepared, overwhelmed with the work and the fame. I enjoyed being with the girls, singing, recording, but it was more about keeping the media interested – there was always a camera in your face. And I had no time for my daughter."}} Nevertheless, Benaissa decided to remain with the band,{{cite web|title=Nadja denkt ans Aufhören|work=[[Der Spiegel]]|url=http://www.spiegel.de/panorama/0,1518,193449,00.html|language=German|accessdate=20 July 2008}} and in the following years the No Angels released another two number-one studio albums, ''[[Now ... Us!]]'' and ''[[Pure (No Angels album)|Pure]]'', a live album and a successful [[Swing (genre)|swing]] album branded ''[[When the Angels Swing]]'', totalling twelve singles altogether – including four-number one singles. Eventually selling more than five million singles and albums worldwide, the No Angels became the best-selling [[Girl group|German girl band]] to date{{cite web|work=Presseportal|title=Bettina Cramer trifft die erfolgreichste deutsche Girlband: BLITZ Spezial über die No Angels am 6.4.2007, 18.45 Uhr|url=http://www.presseportal.de/pm/6708/966608/sat_1|language=German|accessdate=5 April 2007 |quote=''Die erfolgreichste deutsche Girl-Band verkaufte fünf Millionen CDs, erhielt unzählige Auszeichnungen (u.a. "Goldene Kamera", "Echo") und landete vier Nummer-1-Hits.''}} and the most successful girl group of [[Continental Europe]] between the years of 2001 and 2003. On 5 September 2003, the four remaining members of the band ([[Jessica Wahls]] had left the band following the birth of her first child in February 2003) announced that they would no longer be performing together after three years of continual touring and increasing cases of illness. The release of ''[[The Best of No Angels]]'' in November of the same year marked the end of the band, with each member going their separate ways in early 2004. === 2005–2006: Launching a solo career === While her former bandmates pursued solo careers in music and television, Benaissa, who had suffered from intense sleep deprivation,{{cite web|work=Presseportal|title=''Planet'' Interview|url=http://www.planet-interview.de/interviews/pi.php?interview=benaissa-nadja-15032006|accessdate=30 December 2007}} decided to focus on her recovered motherhood the following months. In fall 2004, however, she signed a solo contract with the [[Universal Music|urban music division of Universal Music]] and started work on her debut album. Encouraged to perform [[soul music|soul]] and [[R&B music]] with lyrics in [[German language]] after a 2001 participation in the [[Brothers Keepers|Sisters Keepers]] project's single "Liebe & Verstand," Benaissa decided to focus on writing songs with German lyrics only. As a result, she released her first solo single, "Es Ist Liebe," produced by Tino Oac, in September 2005. The [[Motown]]-inspired ballad received positive reception from music critics, but failed to reach the top 50 of the [[German Singles Chart]]. In the fall of 2005 Benaissa went on tour as a supporting act for the German leg of ''[[Simply Red]] – In Concert''. Afterwards she prepared the release of her second single "Ich Hab Dich," which was chosen to represent [[Hesse]] on the [[Bundesvision Song Contest#Bundesvision Song Contest 2006|2nd Bundesvision Song Contest]]. Benaissa eventually finished fourth with 104 points, while the single entered at number 36 on the [[German Singles Chart]]. Two weeks later ''Schritt für Schritt'' was released, yet barely reaching the top 70. In June 2006, Benaissa participated in another non-profit-making aid project when she provided vocals for the [[Fury in the Slaughterhouse]] cover, "Won't Forget These Days," released during the [[2006 FIFA World Cup]]. === 2007–present: Reformation of the band === [[File:Nadja Benaissa 3.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Benaissa in concert in 2008.]] Although Benaissa was preparing her second studio album for a February 2007 release, involving production by German [[Record producer|producer]]s Audiotreats, DJ Desue, Loomis Green, MRF Entertainment, and Monroe among others,{{cite web|title=''094life.de'' Interview|work=094life.de|url=http://www.094life.de/index.php?page=094tv&video_id=36 |language=German|accessdate=19 February 2008 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070829044920/http://www.094life.de/index.php?page=094tv&video_id=36 |archivedate = 29 August 2007}} she decided to postpone the release in favour of a reunion of the [[No Angels]] in early 2007. However, as all four band members had settled on the continuation of solo projects, Benaissa entered Berlin recording studios in January 2008 to record fifteen new [[Demo (music)|demo songs]], including material she already penned in 2003."Blog." ''Official Nadja Benaissa [[MySpace]]''. According to her [[MySpace]] [[blog]], she finished the album recordings with a second session in March 2008. In May 2010, No Angels began their five-date acoustic "An Intimate Evening With" tour in Munich, their first [[concert tour]] in eight years.{{cite web|date=23 March 2010|title=Exklusive Akustik-Clubtour im Mai 2010 mit Konzerten in München, Frankfurt, Köln, Hamburg & Berlin|publisher=Online-Artikel.de|language=German|url=http://www.online-artikel.de/article/an-intimate-evening-with-no-angels-43246-1.html|accessdate=31 August 2010}} Benaissa did not take part in the tour as she had called in sick a week before, prompting the remaining trio to re-arrange their set at the last minute.{{cite web|date=20 May 2010|title=No Angels: Da Waren’s Nur Noch Drei|publisher=Frankfurter Neue Presse|language=German|url=http://www.fnp.de/fnp/region/lokales/no-angels-da-waren-s-nur-noch-drei_rmn01.c.7710117.de.html|accessdate=30 August 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005145455/http://www.fnp.de/fnp/region/lokales/no-angels-da-waren-s-nur-noch-drei_rmn01.c.7710117.de.html|archivedate=5 October 2011|df=}}{{cite web|date=26 August 2010|title=Bleibt Nadja Benaissa Ein No Angel?|work=Bild|language=German|url=http://www.bild.de/BILD/Newsticker/news-ticker/2010/08/26/26-20-nadja.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100829155241/http://www.bild.de/BILD/Newsticker/news-ticker/2010/08/26/26-20-nadja.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=29 August 2010|accessdate=30 August 2010}} In September 2010, after months of speculation, the singer announced via [[MySpace]] that she had quit the band for good, leaving the No Angels as a trio. In her statement, Benaissa claimed she felt that she had become bigger than the group, stating: "The scandal, the trial – they were overwhelmed by it [...] They'll be fine without me." Also in September 2010, Benaissa released her biography ''Alles wird gut'', written by Tinka Dippel. == Personal life == Benaissa gave birth to a daughter in 1999.{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/lifestyle/people/pop-star-arrested-for-spreading-aids-20090415-a6oo.html|title=Pop star arrested for spreading AIDS|date=15 April 2009|work=Sydney Morning Herald|accessdate=15 April 2009}} Benaissa was diagnosed with HIV when she was 17 during a routine screening after she became pregnant.{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Showbiz-News/German-Pop-Star-Nadja-Benaissa-In-Court-For-Allegedly-Deliberately-Infecting-Partner-With-HIV-Sorry/Article/201008315687848?lpos=Showbiz_News_Top_Stories_Header_3&lid=ARTICLE_15687848_German_Pop_Star_Nadja_Benaissa_In_Court_For_Allegedly_Deliberately_Infecting_Partner_With_HIV_Sorry|title=German Pop Star Nadja Benaissa In Court For Allegedly Deliberately Infecting Partner With HIV Sorry|work=Sky News|date=|accessdate=17 August 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100819224156/http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Showbiz-News/German-Pop-Star-Nadja-Benaissa-In-Court-For-Allegedly-Deliberately-Infecting-Partner-With-HIV-Sorry/Article/201008315687848?lpos=Showbiz_News_Top_Stories_Header_3&lid=ARTICLE_15687848_German_Pop_Star_Nadja_Benaissa_In_Court_For_Allegedly_Deliberately_Infecting_Partner_With_HIV_Sorry|archivedate=19 August 2010|df=}} She was in a relationship for a long time with Senegalese footballer of French citizenship [[Abdou Mbodji]].[http://www.lifego.de/artikel/114/Definitiv-Nadja-von-No-Angels-war-in-schwerer-Drogenkrise.html Definitiv: Nadja von No Angels war in schwerer Drogenkrise!] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090422051542/http://www.lifego.de/artikel/114/Definitiv-Nadja-von-No-Angels-war-in-schwerer-Drogenkrise.html |date=2009-04-22 }} (in German). === Legal problems === On 11 April 2009, Benaissa was arrested on suspicion of having had unprotected intercourse on several occasions in 2004 and 2006 without beforehand informing her partners that she was HIV-positive, allegedly infecting one partner with HIV.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8512933.stm|work=BBC News|title=German star charged in HIV case|date=12 February 2010|accessdate=19 May 2010}}{{cite web|author=Cro|date=14 April 2009|title=German Pop Star Accused of Infecting Partner with HIV|work=Spiegel Online|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/zeitgeist/0,1518,618910,00.html|accessdate=14 April 2009}} She was remanded into custody, after a judge ruled there was a danger she might repeat the alleged offence,{{cite news|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/entertainment_news/article6092258.ece|title=Singer with most popular German band faces jail for 'infecting man with HIV'|last=Yeoman|first=Fran|date=14 April 2009|work=The Times|accessdate=15 April 2009}} but eventually released on 21 April 2009, subject to unnamed conditions.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8011056.stm|title=German star in HIV case released|date=21 April 2009|work=BBC News|accessdate=21 April 2009}} On 12 February 2010, she was charged with causing bodily harm, an offence carrying a sentence of six months to ten years imprisonment. On 16 August 2010 she admitted in court to having had unprotected sex without telling her partners she was HIV-positive, but denied deliberately causing any infection.[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,599546,00.html HIV-Positive Pop Star Admits to Having Unprotected Sex] Fox News. Retrieved 16 August 2010. Benaissa had unprotected sex with three men between 2000 and 2004. One of her partners became infected with HIV. The victim found out that Benaissa has HIV after speaking with her aunt. He later got tested and found that he had contracted the virus.{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/europe/08/26/germany.hiv.case/?hpt=T2|title=HIV-infected German Singer Convicted|work=CNN|date=26 August 2010|accessdate=26 August 2010}} On 26 August 2010, she was found guilty on one count of causing grievous bodily harm and two of attempted bodily harm and was given a 2-year suspended sentence.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-11097298|title=Suspended sentence for German HIV singer Nadja Benaissa|work=BBC News|date=26 August 2010|accessdate=26 August 2010}} == Discography == {{See also|No Angels discography}} === Albums === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! style="width:14em;" rowspan="2"| Title ! colspan="2"| Chart positions |- ! style="width:3.5em;font-size:90%;"| [[Germany|GER]]

{{Infobox music festival |music_festival_name= Oxford Odissi Festival |image= Oxford Odissi festival 4.jpg |location= [[University of Oxford]], [[Oxford]], [[United Kingdom]] | years_active= 2015 - Present | dates= Annually, last week of May | genre= [[Indian classical dance]] | founders= [[Baisali Mohanty]] | website= }} [[File:Oxford Odissi Festival 5.jpg|thumb|left|Audience enjoying a performance at the 2016 Oxford Odissi Festival held on May 27 at [[University of Oxford]].]] [[File:Ileana Citaristi at Oxford Odissi Centre event.jpg|thumb|left|Renowned dancer and choreographer [[Ileana Citaristi]] performing at Oxford Odissi Festival held on May 27, 2016, at [[University of Oxford]].]] [[File:Oxford Odissi Festival 2017.jpg|thumb|left|A performance at the festival held on February 11, 2017, at the auditorium of [[St John's College, Oxford]].]]
'''Oxford Odissi Festival''' is an annual [[Indian classical dance]] festival held at [[University of Oxford]], [[United Kingdom]].
The festival was founded by [[Indian people|Indian]] dancer and choreographer [[Baisali Mohanty]] in 2015 and is organised by [[Oxford Odissi Centre]] in association with the [[High Commission of India to the United Kingdom]].<ref>http://www.southasia.ox.ac.uk/oxford-odissi-festival</ref><ref>http://www.dailypioneer.com/state-editions/bhubaneswar/odishi-fest-at-oxford-varsity-from-today.html</ref>
[[File:UK-2014-Oxford-Magdalen College 08.jpg|thumb|Magdalen College of [[University of Oxford]], the venue for the festival]] Beside exhibiting new and innovative choreographies in [[Odissi]], the festival showcases all forms of [[Indian classical dance]]. <ref>http://odishasuntimes.com/2016/05/05/applause-odissi-dance-festival-makes-it-to-oxford-university/</ref><ref>http://www.citynewsline.co.uk/news/odissi-festival-to-be-held-at-oxford-university-on-may-27{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
== History == The festival was conceptualised by [[Baisali Mohanty]], a Master’s Degree student at [[University of Oxford]] and a classical dancer and choreographer, to help popularise [[Odissi]] and other forms of [[Indian classical dance]] at one of the premier seat of learning. <ref>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160504/jsp/odisha/story_83592.jsp</ref> <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.orissadiary.com/CurrentNews.asp?id=67003 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-06-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160506163458/http://orissadiary.com/CurrentNews.asp?id=67003 |archivedate=2016-05-06 |df= }}</ref>
The first edition of the festival was held on May 27, 2016, at the Grove Auditorium of [[Magdalen College]], [[University of Oxford]]. <ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.prameyanews7.com/en/may2016/odisha/24350/3-day-Odissi-fest-at-Oxford-University-from-today-Odissi-fest-at-Oxford-UniversityOdisha.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2016-06-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160602160925/http://www.prameyanews7.com/en/may2016/odisha/24350/3-day-Odissi-fest-at-Oxford-University-from-today-Odissi-fest-at-Oxford-UniversityOdisha.htm |archivedate=2016-06-02 |df= }}</ref>
== Festival Programme == The festival hosts solo, duet and group choreographies. A major attraction of the festival is a fusion featuring [[Odissi]], [[Kathak]], [[Bharata Natyam]] and [[Mohiniyattam]], highlighting the interconnectedness that runs through this different dance forms, as a reflection of the underlying unity among diverse [[India]]n culture. <ref>http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160113/jsp/odisha/story_63528.jsp </ref><ref>http://odishasuntimes.com/2016/05/31/odissi-festival-gets-rousing-reception-oxford-university/</ref>

'''PLATINUM''' is the name given by [[Microsoft]] to a [[cybercrime]] collective active against governments and related organizations in [[South Asia|South]] and [[Southeast Asia]].<ref name="ms-2017-06">{{cite web|url=https://download.microsoft.com/download/2/2/5/225BFE3E-E1DE-4F5B-A77B-71200928D209/Platinum%20feature%20article%20-%20Targeted%20attacks%20in%20South%20and%20Southeast%20Asia%20April%202016.pdf |title=PLATINUM Targeted attacks in South andSoutheast Asia (PDF) |publisher=Windows Defender Advanced Threat Hunting Team (Microsoft) |date=2016 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref> They are secretive and not much is known about the members of the group.<ref name="zdnet2017">{{Cite news|url=http://www.zdnet.com/article/platinum-cybercriminals-abuses-windows-patching-system-to-stay-hidden/|title=Platinum hacking group abuses Windows patching system in active campaigns {{!}} ZDNet|last=Osborne|first=Charlie|work=ZDNet|access-date=2017-06-09|language=en}}</ref> The group's skill means that its attacks sometimes go without detection for many years.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
The group, considered an [[advanced persistent threat]], has been active since at least 2009,<ref>{{cite web|author=Eduard Kovacs |url=http://www.securityweek.com/platinum-cyberspies-abuse-intel-amt-evade-detection |title="Platinum" Cyberspies Abuse Intel AMT to Evade Detection |publisher=SecurityWeek.Com |date=2017-06-08 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref> targeting victims via [[spear-phishing]] attacks against government officials' private email addresses, [[Zero-day (computing)|zero-day]] exploits, and hot-patching vulnerabilities.<ref>{{cite web|author=Eduard Kovacs |url=http://www.securityweek.com/platinum-cyberspies-abuse-hotpatching-asia-attacks |title="Platinum" Cyberspies Abuse Hotpatching in Asia Attacks |publisher=SecurityWeek.Com |date=2016-04-27 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=msft-mmpc |url=https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/mmpc/2016/04/26/digging-deep-for-platinum/ |title=Digging deep for PLATINUM – Windows Security |publisher=Blogs.technet.microsoft.com |date=2016-04-26 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref> Upon gaining access to their victims' computers, the group steals economically sensitive information.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
PLATINUM succeeded in keeping a low profile until their abuse of the Microsoft Windows hot patching system was detected and publicly reported in April 2016.<ref name="zdnet2017"/> This hot patching method allows them to use Microsoft's own features to quickly patch, alter files or update an application, without rebooting the system altogether, this way, they can maintain the data they have stolen while masking their identity.<ref name="zdnet2017"/>
In June 2017, PLATINUM became notable for exploiting the [[Serial over LAN|serial over LAN (SOL)]] capabilities of Intel's [[Active Management Technology]] to perform data exfiltration.<ref>{{cite web|author=Peter Bright |url=https://arstechnica.com/security/2017/06/sneaky-hackers-use-intel-management-tools-to-bypass-windows-firewall/ |title=Sneaky hackers use Intel management tools to bypass Windows firewall |publisher=Ars Technica |date=2017-06-09 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Tung |first=Liam |url=http://www.zdnet.com/article/windows-firewall-dodged-by-hot-patching-spies-using-intel-amt-says-microsoft/ |title=Windows firewall dodged by 'hot-patching' spies using Intel AMT, says Microsoft |publisher=ZDNet |date=2014-07-22 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref name="microsoft1">{{cite web|author=msft-mmpc |url=https://blogs.technet.microsoft.com/mmpc/2017/06/07/platinum-continues-to-evolve-find-ways-to-maintain-invisibility/ |title=PLATINUM continues to evolve, find ways to maintain invisibility – Windows Security |publisher=Blogs.technet.microsoft.com |date=2017-06-07 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Catalin Cimpanu |url=https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/malware-uses-obscure-intel-cpu-feature-to-steal-data-and-avoid-firewalls/ |title=Malware Uses Obscure Intel CPU Feature to Steal Data and Avoid Firewalls |publisher=Bleepingcomputer.com |date=2017-06-08 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Juha Saarinen |url=https://www.itnews.com.au/news/hackers-abuse-low-level-management-feature-for-invisible-backdoor-464499 |title=Hackers abuse low-level management feature for invisible backdoor - Security |publisher=iTnews |date=2017-06-08 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref name="microsoft1"/><ref>{{cite web|author=Richard Chirgwin |url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/AMP/2017/06/08/vxers_exploit_intels_amt_for_malwareoverlan/ |title=Vxers exploit Intel's Active Management for malware-over-LAN. Platinum attack spotted in Asia, needs admin credentials |publisher=The Register |date=2017-06-08 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Christof Windeck |url=https://www.heise.de/security/meldung/Intel-Fernwartung-AMT-bei-Angriffen-auf-PCs-genutzt-3739441.html |title=Intel-Fernwartung AMT bei Angriffen auf PCs genutzt | heise Security |publisher=Heise.de |date=2017-06-09 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/Windows-Security-Blog/PLATINUM-activity-group-file-transfer-method-using-Intel-AMT-SOL |title=PLATINUM activity group file-transfer method using Intel AMT SOL | Windows Security Blog | Channel 9 |publisher=Channel9.msdn.com |date=2017-06-07 |accessdate=2017-06-10}}</ref>
==PLATINUM's techniques== {{clarify|text=PLATINUM has been known to exploit web [[plugins]], at one point infiltrating the computers of several Indian government officials 2009, using a website that provided an email service.|reason=How does exploiting web plugins related to providing an email service?|date=October 2017}}<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
Once in control of a target's computer, PLATINUM actors can move through the target's [[Computer network|network]] using specially built [[malware]] which is either made by one of the multiple teams they are believed to have or sold through an outside source 2009.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
Because of the diversity of this malware, which has little code in common, Microsoft's investigators taxonomised it into families.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
The piece of malware most widely-used by PLATINUM was nicknamed Dispind by Microsoft.<ref name="ms-2017-06" /> This piece of malware can install a [[keystroke logging|keylogger]], a piece of software that records (and may also be able to inject) keystrokes.{{citation needed|date=October 2017}}
PLATINUM also uses other malware like "JPIN" which installs itself into the %appdata% folder of a computer so that it can obtain information, load a keylogger, download files and updates, and perform other tasks like extracting files that could contain sensitive information.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
"Adbupd" is another malware program utilised by PLATINUM, and is similar to the two previously mentioned. It is known for its ability to support plugins, so it can be specialised, making it versatile enough to adapt to various protection mechanisms.<ref name="ms-2017-06" />
===Intel Exploit=== In 2017, Microsoft reported that PLATINUM had begun to exploit a feature of Intel [[CPU]]s.<ref name=Tad2017>[https://www.tad.bg/en/post/platinum-hacker-group-uses-intel-amt "Platinum hacker group uses Intel AMT"], ''Tad Group'', 2017-09-25</ref> The feature in question is Intel's AMT Serial-over-LAN (SOL), which allows a user to remotely control another computer, bypassing the host [[operating system]] of the target, including firewalls and monitoring tools within the host operating system.<ref name="Tad2017"/>
==Security== Microsoft advises users to apply all of their security updates to minimize vulnerabilities and to keep highly sensitive data out of large networks.<ref name="ms-2017-06" /> Because PLATINUM targets organizations, companies and government branches to acquire trade secrets, anyone working in or with such organizations can be a target for the group.<ref>{{cite book |last=Liu |first=Jianhong |date=2017-07-15 |title=Comparative Criminology in Asia |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xi8tDwAAQBAJ&pg=PA139&lpg=PA139&dq=platinum+cyber+crime&source=bl&ots=Qs3dh6MXHr&sig=AJcCS3a2fp0xTYlz1phCVi7QCf4&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwie243j28DWAhVIbSYKHV5FAx84ChDoAQgtMAE#v=onepage&q=platinum&f=false|publisher=Springer}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Intel AMT#Known vulnerabilities and exploits]]

{{demoscene}} '''Pilgrimage''' was a [[demoparty]] which took place annually in [[Salt Lake City, Utah]] each summer between 2003 and 2006. The event was founded by Rich "Legalize" Thompson of the demoscene group Polygony. <ref name=3dluvr>{{cite news|url=http://www.acid.org/images/pilgrimage04/interview/interview-pilgrimage-2004-3dluvr-ccrat.html |title=Pilgrimage Inc Interview - Pilgrimage Demo Party 2004 |work= |publisher=3DLUVR.com |date=August 29, 2004 |last1=Caballo |first1=Enrique |last2= |first2= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110927061745/http://www.acid.org/images/pilgrimage04/interview/interview-pilgrimage-2004-3dluvr-ccrat.html |archivedate=September 27, 2011 }}</ref> Pilgrimage was, at the time, the only active demoscene event of its kind in all of [[North America]] (succeeding events such as NAID), while many demoparties take place annually throughout [[Europe]].
==Party features== === Competitions === Pilgrimage hosted a variety of different [[Compo (demoscene)|compos]], most of which require a skill in electronic art and/or computer programming, such as:
* [[Demo (computer programming)|Demo]] * Combined Music ([[MP3]] and tracked music) * [[Pixel]] [[digital art|Graphics]] * [[text mode|Text Mode]] [[ASCII art|Graphics]] * "Blender" competition (equivalent to fast-compos at European demoparties) * "Wildcard" (equivalent to wild-compos at European demoparties)
In 2004, Pilgrimage managed to raise over [[US Dollar|US $]]14,000 in [[currency|cash]] and [[prize]]s to award winners of each of the various competitions, double that of the previous year. <ref>[Pilgrimage 2004 Press release - rhizome.org - March 31, 2004 http://rhizome.org/announce/events/24318/view/]</ref> Major sponsors that year included Utah's largest independent ISP XMission, [[ACiD Productions|ACiD]], [[ATI Technologies]], [[Bawls]], [[Microsoft]], and [[DeviantArt]].
=== Seminars === [[Image:Pgm04b-roots-elwix-x768.png|thumb|right|Elwix presents his seminar on the history of the North American [[Commodore 64]] demoscene.]]
In addition to competitions, which are the main focal point of any demo party, Pilgrimage also hosted seminars on art and technology-related subjects such as 3D programming and design, the history of art in computing, and game design. <ref name=hugi31>{{cite news|url=http://hugi.scene.org/online/hugi31/hugi%2031%20-%20demoscene%20parties%20polaris%20pilgrimage%202005%20report.htm|title=Pilgrimage 2005 Party Report|work=HUGI Magazine|publisher=|date=2005|last1=Polaris|first1= |last2= |first2= }}</ref>
===Activities=== [[Image:Pgm04b-compos-audience watches-x768.png|thumb|right|200px|Members of the audience oversee the demo competition, vote sheets in hand.]] Pilgrimage 2004 included the following activities:
* A [[Dance Dance Revolution]] tourney, including several "old school/new school" matchups. * A city-spanning [[scavenger hunt]] organized by members the local [[2600: The Hacker Quarterly|2600 meeting]]. * A demoscene trivia quiz show hosted by [[Jason Scott Sadofsky|Jason Scott]] and Severina * A demonstration of how the popular Finnish cocktail [[Salmiakki Koskenkorva]] can be made, including a beverage tasting
In 2004, main organizer Legalize stirred up quite a few attenders during his opening speech of the party, where he (in response to European critics of the party) verbally offended the complete European demoscene, labelling them "[[Eurotrash (term)|Eurotrash]]".<ref>[http://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=10836 www.pouet.net]</ref> He also delivered a side-jab to attenders from [[Canada]] stating that they are "wussies", as they don't have an active demoparty anymore - to which the members of demogroup Northern Dragons responded that the actual party invitation demo was "written by Canadians". <ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20060222035450/http://www.scenerep.org/scenezine/issue16.php#2 Scene Zine Issue #16 - Party Report: Pilgrimage 2K4]</ref> The Northern Dragons gave another tongue-in-cheek response to the controversy in 2005 by naming their winning demo entry "Eurotrash".
==References== {{reflist}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20040820104912/http://silicon-valley.siggraph.org/MeetingNotes/Utah.html The Inception of Computer Graphics] — The relationship between Utah and Computer Graphics. * [http://demoscene.us/parties/ North American Demo Parties] — A list of all North American demo parties.
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20050305191933/http://pilgrimage.scene.org/ Pilgrimage official website] : [http://pilgrimage.scene.org/2005/index.html Pilgrimage 2005 (archived)] : [http://pilgrimage.scene.org/2004/index.html Pilgrimage 2004 (archived)] : [http://pilgrimage.scene.org/2003/index.html Pilgrimage 2003 (archived)] * [http://www.pouet.net/party.php?which=458 Pilgrimage demoparty releases] indexed at [[Pouet]]. * [http://www.slengpung.com/v3/parties.php?id=342 Pilgrimage 2004 photographs] hosted on Slengpung.

A '''presidential inauguration''' is a [[ceremony|ceremonial]] event centered on the formal transition of a new [[president]] into office, usually in [[democracies]] where this official has been elected. Frequently, this involves the swearing of an [[oath of office]].
Examples of presidential inaugurations include: *[[Brazilian presidential inauguration]] *[[French presidential inauguration]] *[[Irish presidential inauguration]] *[[Philippine presidential inauguration]] *[[Russian presidential inauguration]] *[[United States presidential inauguration]]

{{Infobox recurring event | name = | logo = | image = | imagesize = 300px | caption = | genre = Fashion show, exhibitions and competitions | date = | frequency = Semi-annually | location = [[Novi Sad]], Serbia | first = | prev = <!-- [[previous event]] --> | next = <!-- [[next event]] --> | participants = Serbian and international designers, industry experts | attendance = 30,000/year | area = | budget = | patron = | organised = | founder_name = Svetlana Horvat | member = | website = http://www.serbiafashionweek.com | footnotes = }} '''Serbia Fashion Week''' is a fashion show held twice a year in [[Novi Sad]], [[Serbia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.irishnews.com/lifestyle/2017/09/02/news/danube-city-novi-sad-is-the-jewel-in-serbia-s-crown-1123565/|title=Danube city Novi Sad is the jewel in Serbia's crown|website=The Irish News}}</ref> Occurring in April and November, the event attracts local and international fashion designers, such as [[Thierry Mugler]] and [[Anna Fendi]]. In addition to runway shows, seminars and exhibits, the "Fashion Talent Design Competition" helps promote young Serbian designers by showcasing their collections. The seven day festival also highlights the works of applied artists, musicians, interior decorators, multimedia experts and architects.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://novisad.travel/en/events/serbia-fashion-week-2/|title=Serbia Fashion Week - TONS|publisher=}}</ref>
The fashion show portion is often held at the Congress Centre Master of the Novi Sad Fair, a multi-functional venue situated near the center of the city. Other locations are used as well, for the opening shows, concerts, and art exhibits. Each year, about 30,000 visitors attend with approximately 60 fashion designers, from 20 different countries, presenting their collections.<ref name="auto">{{cite web|url=https://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20171231/fashion-beauty/Maltese-designer-at-Serbia-Fashion-Week.666847|title=Maltese designer at Serbia Fashion Week|first=Allied Newspapers|last=Ltd|publisher=}}</ref><ref name="belgrade-beat.com">{{cite web|url=https://belgrade-beat.com/magazine/2017/11/serbian-fashion-week-autumnwinter-201718|title=Serbian Fashion Week Autumn/Winter 2017/18 - Belgrade Beat|website=belgrade-beat.com}}</ref><ref name="blic.rs">{{cite web|url=https://zena.blic.rs/moda/spektakularno-zatvaranje-novembarskog-serbia-fashion-weeka-zabelezeno-vise-od-35000/nm45zt6|title=Spektakularno zatvaranje novembarskog Serbia Fashion Weeka: Zabeleženo više od 35.000 posetilaca!|publisher=}}</ref>
==About== Partially sponsored by the municipal government, Serbia Fashion Week was founded in 2013 by current head Svetlana Horvat. Having worked as a womenswear designer, she is also the current president of the National Serbian Chamber of Fashion.<ref name="topsrbija.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.topsrbija.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=6533:svetlana-horvat-najavila-spektakularnu-nacionalnu-nedelju-mode-&catid=320:manastiri&Itemid=563|title=Svetlana Horvat najavila spektakularnu Nacionalnu nedelju mode|website=www.topsrbija.com}}</ref><ref name="auto1">{{cite web|url=http://rtv.rs/sr_ci/vojvodina/novi-sad/serbia-fashion-week-od-24.-do-29.-aprila-na-pet-lokacija-u-ns_911596.html|title="Serbia fashion week" од 24. до 29. априла на пет локација у НС|first=Јавна медијска установа ЈМУ Радио-телевизија|last=Војводине|website=ЈМУ Радио-телевизија Војводине}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.novisad.rs/otvara-e-prvog-serbia-fashion-week|title=ОТВАРАЊЕ ПРВОГ „SERBIA FASHION WEEK“ - Novi Sad|website=www.novisad.rs}}</ref> On October 31, 2013, Horvat made the fashion week official by signing the "Protocol on Cooperation" with the national [[European Fashion Council|Fashion Councils]] of eight other European countries.<ref name="europaregina.eu">{{cite web|url=http://europaregina.eu/fashion-week/serbia-fashion-week/|title=Serbia Fashion Week - World Fashion Calendar, International Fashion Weeks|website=europaregina.eu}}</ref><ref name="novisad.rs">{{cite web|url=http://www.novisad.rs/otvara-e-prvog-serbia-fashion-week-u-novom-sadu|title=ОТВАРАЊЕ ПРВОГ „SERBIA FASHION WEEK“ У НОВОМ САДУ - Novi Sad|website=www.novisad.rs}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://europaregina.eu/organizations/european-fashion-council/european-fashion-council-03272012.htm|title=Serbia is the 19th member state of the European Fashion Council|publisher=}}</ref>
The event's main objective is to present Serbian talent alongside designers from established European fashion capitals.<ref name="europaregina.eu"/> Other goals include encouraging the local textile and manufacturing industries, as well as promoting tourism in the area.<ref name="europaregina.eu"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://europaregina.eu/fashion-weeks/fashion-weeks-europe/serbia-fashion-week|title=Serbia Fashion Week - Serbia, Europe|publisher=}}</ref>
==Highlights== === SFW 2013 === The very first Serbia Fashion Week took place from October 31st to November 2nd, 2013. It featured designers from Serbia, the Netherlands, Hungary, Bulgaria, among others.<ref name="novisad.rs"/><ref name="europaregina.eu"/> French designer Eymeric François opened the show and Marcellous L. Jones, owner of "Fashion Insider TV", acted as adviser for the event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lepotaizdravlje.rs/lifestyle/inspirisemo-vas/u-novom-sadu-otvoren-serbia-fashion-week/|title=U Novom Sadu otvoren Serbia Fashion Week|website=lepotaizdravlje.rs}}</ref><ref name="svet.rs">{{cite web|url=http://www.svet.rs/vesti/estrada/uskoro-prvi-serbia-fashion-week|title=Uskoro prvi Serbia Fashion Week|publisher=}}</ref> Two main themes defined the festival, High Fashion and Urban Fashion, with runway shows held at locations such as the [[Assembly of Vojvodina]].<ref name="novisad.rs"/> A conference on fashion branding also took place at the assembly building.<ref name="belgrade-beat.com"/> About 2,500 visitors attended the first festival in 2013.<ref name="belgrade-beat.com"/> As part of the "Designer Exchange" program, local talent Biljana Tipsarević was later able to represent Serbia at [[Malta]] Fashion Week.<ref name="svet.rs"/> === SFW 2014 === The special guest of honour, at the October 2014 edition, was [[Maastricht]] mayor, [[Onno Hoes]], who participated in the Fashion Educational Conference Series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/zivot-i-stil/1268532-za-serbia-fashion-week-trazi-se-karta-vise-foto|title=Za Serbia Fashion Week traži se karta više! (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs}}</ref><ref name="thefashioninsider.com">http://thefashioninsider.com/2014/11/21/serbia-fashion-week-posts-spectacular-growth/</ref> He spoke about the role of city governments in helping fashion events evolve.<ref name="thefashioninsider.com"/> The opening ceremony took place at the [[Eđšeg]] chateau. Local designers, who presented their collections, included [[Verica Rakocević]], Marija Šabić, [[Zvonko Marković]], [[Bata Spasojević]], and Milena Radović.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hellomagazin.rs/moda/modne-vesti/serbia-fashion-week-nedelja-kreativnosti-u-novom-sadu/|title=Serbia Fashion Week: Nedelja kreativnosti u Novom Sadu|publisher=}}</ref> That same year, Dutch designers began regularly showing their clothing lines, after a cooperation agreement between Serbia Fashion Week and FashionClash festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fashionclash.nl/fashionclash-serbia-fashion-week/|title=FASHIONCLASH & Serbia Fashion Week|website=FASHIONCLASH}}</ref> Art exhibits included the works of French photographer [[Thomas Devaux]] and Serbian sculptor Vladimir Labat Rovnjev.<ref name="thefashioninsider.com"/> The festival saw 14,000 visitors in 2014.<ref name="thefashioninsider.com"/> === SFW 2015 === Inspired by [[David Bowie]], one runway show in April 2015 was called "Heros" and spotlighted about 20 Serbian designers.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://zena.blic.rs/moda/revijom-heroji-otvoren-serbia-fashion-week/6wj34fh|title=Revijom "Heroji" otvoren Serbia Fashion Week|publisher=}}</ref> [[Vogue Italia|Italian Vogue]] covered the event's spring edition, mentioning local talents Zorana Milicic and Marija Stankovic.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.it/en/talents/news/2015/05/serbia-fashion-week?refresh_ce=|title=Serbia Fashion Week - Vogue.it|publisher=}}</ref> French designer Eymeric François also participated, presenting his collection on the second day.<ref name="auto2">{{cite web|url=http://www.rtv.rs/sr_lat/zivot/zenski-kutak/vise-od-50-dizajnera-iz-srbije-i-evrope-na-nacionalnoj-nedelji-mode_578417.html|title=Više od 50 dizajnera iz Srbije i Evrope na nacionalnoj nedelji mode|first=Javna medijska ustanova JMU Radio-televizija|last=Vojvodine|website=JMU Radio-televizija Vojvodine}}</ref> A seminar on "Digital Marketing in the Fashion Industry" took place as well.<ref name="auto2"/> At the November show, the awards ceremony was held at the [[Petrovaradin Fortress]], with presentations made by fashion critic Marcellous L. Jones and Donald Potard, former managing director of the [[Jean Paul Gautier]] fashion house.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hellomagazin.rs/moda/modne-vesti/serbia-fashion-week-svecano-dodeljene-modne-nagrade/|title=Serbia Fashion Week: Svečano dodeljene modne nagrade|publisher=}}</ref><ref name="belgrade-beat.com"/> === SFW 2016 === In 2016, Novi Sad's Popovic sisters, Mila and Tijana, focused on eco-design, by presenting garments made of recycled materials.<ref name="mojnovisad.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.mojnovisad.com/vesti/serbia-fashion-week-kratki-vodic-kroz-novosadsku-nedelju-mode-id8920.html|title=Serbia Fashion Week: Kratki vodič kroz novosadsku Nedelju mode|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mojnovisad.com/vesti/tijana-i-mila-popovic-novosadjanke-cije-modele-nosi-i-billy-idol-id7559.html|title=[GRADSKE FACE] Tijana i Mila Popović: Novosađanke čije modele nosi i Billy Idol|publisher=}}</ref> International designers at the show included German Isabell De Hellerin and Slovenian Nika Ravnik, as well as Lesia Semi from the Ukraine.<ref name="mojnovisad.com"/> Prizes were handed out at the French embassy in [[Belgrade]], with jury members consisting of fashion expert Donald Potard and designer [[Anna Fendi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/zivot-i-stil/2458910-zavrsnica-serbia-fashion-weeka-krunisana-glamuroznom-dodelom-nagrada-serbia-fashion-awards-foto|title=Završnica SERBIA FASHION WEEKA krunisana glamuroznom dodelom nagrada - SERBIA FASHION AWARDS! (FOTO)|website=www.telegraf.rs}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.it/en/vogue-talents/news/2016/11/22/serbia-fashion-week-spring-summer-2017/|title=Serbia Fashion Week 2016|date=22 November 2016|publisher=}}</ref> [[Fendi]] also visited Novi Sad to promote her new selection of wines from her AFV label.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraf.rs/zivot-i-stil/2398276-anna-fendi-dolazi-na-serbia-fashion-week|title=ANNA FENDI dolazi na Serbia Fashion Week!|website=www.telegraf.rs}}</ref> Additionally, the Novi Sad event was showcased at [[New York Fashion Week]], featuring the collections of local designers [[Bata Spasojević]] and Marina Ilić.<ref name="topsrbija.com"/><ref>https://newyorkstyleguide.com/marinia-by-marina-ilic-show-new-york-fashion-week-art-hearts-fashion/</ref> An exchange of designers also took place between D.C. Fashion Week and Serbia Fashion Week.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.afro.com/ean-williams-rips-the-runway-as-director-of-d-c-fashion-week/|title=Ean Williams Rips the Runway as Director of D.C. Fashion Week - Afro|website=www.afro.com}}</ref>
=== SFW 2017 === In 2017, designer Suzana Perić had a runway show noted for its boho style and local pop singer [[Ana Stanić]] performed at the festival.<ref name="blic.rs"/> Italian fashion was highlighted, as well as showcasing designers from Croatia, Spain, Romania and Belarus.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://it.fashionnetwork.com/news/La-moda-Made-in-Italy-protagonista-alla-Serbia-Fashion-Week,896693.html#.WzZMA2BKjcc|title=La moda Made in Italy protagonista alla Serbia Fashion Week|first=|last=FashionNetwork.com|publisher=}}</ref> A new segment at the event, featuring films about fashion, was inaugurated, with cinematic works from various film festivals being shown.<ref name="blic.rs1">{{cite web|url=https://zena.blic.rs/moda/umetnost-avangarda-i-biznis-serbia-fashion-week-povezao-dizajnere-sa-cetiri/md016wg|title=Umetnost, avangarda i biznis: Serbia Fashion Week povezao dizajnere sa četiri kontinenta|publisher=}}</ref> Additionally, a number of foreign fashion press were in attendance, including World of Fashion (Italy), Runway Manhattan (USA), Fashion Insider (USA), and El Sharkiah Magazine (Saudi Arabia).<ref name="blic.rs1"/> The executive director of Malta Fashion Week, Adrian Mizzi, gave out awards at the closing ceremonies, held at the Italian embassy in [[Belgrade]]. He was accompanied by [[Gucci]] Fashion House heiress, Patricia Gucci, who also signed copies of her new book, which was published in the Serbian language and examines her family’s clothing empire.<ref name="auto"/><ref name="belgrade-beat.com"/> <ref name="blic.rs"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtv.rs/sr_ci/vojvodina/novi-sad/serbia-fashion-week-od-20.-do-27.-novembra_870050.html|title=''Serbia fashion week'' од 20. до 27. новембра - ЈМУ Радио-телевизија Војводине|first=Јавна медијска установа ЈМУ Радио-телевизија|last=Војводине|website=ЈМУ Радио-телевизија Војводине}}</ref> By 2017, the number of visitors to Serbia Fashion Week had jumped to 30,000.<ref name="belgrade-beat.com"/>
=== SFW 2018 === In April 2018, fashion designer [[Thierry Mugler]] was the special guest and featured designer, celebrating the 10th jubilee edition of the festival.<ref name="auto1"/><ref name="lepotaizdravlje.rs">{{cite web|url=http://www.lepotaizdravlje.rs/lifestyle/promo/serbia-fashion-week-zatvoren-nevidenim-modnim-souom/|title=Serbia Fashion Week zatvoren neviđenim modnim šouom|website=lepotaizdravlje.rs}}</ref> The opening ceremony took place on a giant runway in [[Danube Park]] and the awards ceremony was held at the [[Serbian National Theater]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/lifestyle.305.html:724114-Serbia-Fashion-Week-otvoren-spektaklom-pod-vedrim-nebom-FOTO|title=Serbia Fashion Week otvoren spektaklom pod vedrim nebom (FOTO)|website=www.novosti.rs}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rtv.rs/sr_ci/vojvodina/novi-sad/mladost-glamur-i-novi-trendovi-na-serbia-fashion-week-u-(video)_913448.html|title=Младост, гламур и нови трендови на Serbia Fashion Week-у (ВИДЕО)|first=Јавна медијска установа ЈМУ Радио-телевизија|last=Војводине|website=ЈМУ Радио-телевизија Војводине}}</ref><ref name="serbiafashionweek.com">{{cite web|url=http://serbiafashionweek.com/en/2018/04/30/sfw-april-2018-tomorrow/|title=SERBIA FASHION WEEK APRIL 2018 STARTS TOMORROW|date=30 April 2018|publisher=}}</ref> Designer [[Zvonko Marković]] celebrated 20 years in the fashion industry by presenting a special collection.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://zena.blic.rs/moda/modna-bajka-zvonka-markovica-na-serbia-fashion-weeku/g9vbxbj|title=Modna bajka Zvonka Markovića na Serbia Fashion Weeku|publisher=}}</ref> Local pop singer [[Tijana Bogićević]] performed her Eurovision entry "In Too Deep" while wearing a 60 meter long dress.<ref name="lepotaizdravlje.rs"/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://eurovoix.com/2017/04/25/serbia-tijana-bogicevic-opens-serbia-fashion-week/|title=Serbia: Tijana Bogićević Opens Serbia Fashion Week - Eurovoix|date=25 April 2017|publisher=}}</ref> Sales advisor Barbara Locatelli and fashion editor Myra Postolache led some of the educational seminars on business and public relations.<ref name="serbiafashionweek.com"/> Representatives from [[Vancouver Fashion Week]] and Holland's Fashionclash show were also in attendance.

agreedbody3 further amends legislation --> | passedbody4 = | passeddate4 = | passedvote4 = | signedpresident = George H.W. Bush | signeddate = October 24, 1992 | unsignedpresident = <!-- used when passed without presidential signing --> | unsigneddate = <!-- used when passed without presidential signing --> | vetoedpresident = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | vetoeddate = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenbody1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddendate1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenvote1 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenbody2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddendate2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | overriddenvote2 = <!-- used when passed by overriding presidential veto --> | amendments = | SCOTUS cases = }} '''Soviet Scientists Immigration Act of 1992''' granted authorization for [[Engineer|engineers]] and [[Scientist|scientists]] from the [[post-Soviet states]] to acquire employment within America. The [[Act of Congress]] implemented specific provisions of the [[Immigration and Nationality Act]] providing [[Visa policy of the United States|United States visas]] for former [[Soviet Union]] [[Foreign national|foreign nationals]] classified as scientific immigrants being employed in the [[Contiguous United States|continental United States]].
The Senate [[Bill (law)|bill]] was passed by the 102nd United States Congressional session and enacted into law by the [[Presidency of George H. W. Bush|41st President of the United States]] George H.W. Bush on October 24, 1992.
==Provisions of the Act== The 1992 public law was authored as four sections defining requirements for the post-Soviet states whose citizens were seeking residency in the United States while possessing advanced [[List of engineering branches|engineering]] and [[Branches of science|scientific]] [[Discipline (academia)|disciplines]].
:'''Short Title''' :* Act cited as the ''Soviet Scientists Immigration Act of 1992'' :'''Definitions''' :* [[Baltic states]] means the [[Sovereign state|sovereign nations]] of [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], and [[Lithuania]] :* [[Post-Soviet states|Independent states of the former Soviet Union]] means the sovereign nations of [[Armenia]], [[Azerbaijan]], [[Belarus]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Kyrgyzstan]], [[Moldova]], [[Russia]], [[Tajikistan]], [[Turkmenistan]], [[Ukraine]], and [[Uzbekistan]] :* Eligible independent states and Baltic scientists means nationals of any of the independent states of the former Soviet Union or the Baltic states :* Scientists or engineers who have expertise in [[Biological engineering|biological]], [[Chemical engineering|chemical]], [[Nuclear engineering|nuclear]], or other [[High tech|high technology]] fields or who are working on biological, chemical, nuclear, or other high-technology defense projects. :'''Waiver of Job Offer Requirement''' :* Foreign national services in [[the arts]], [[business]], or [[science]] be sought by an employer in the United States shall not apply to any eligible independent states or Baltic scientist who is applying for admission to the United States for [[Permanent residence (United States)|permanent residence]]. :'''Classification of Independent States Scientists as Having Exceptional Ability''' :* Class of eligible independent states and Baltic scientists, based on their level of expertise, as [[Alien (law)|aliens]] who possess exceptional ability in the sciences, for purposes of the Immigration and Nationality Act, whether or not such scientists possess [[Academic degree|advanced degrees]]. :* Eligible independent states and Baltic scientists are limited to seven hundred and fifty who may receive [[Travel visa|visas]] for four years or as specified by the Immigration and Nationality Act.
==Amendment to 1992 Act== Soviet Scientists Immigration Act was amended on September 30, 2002 with enactment of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/PLAW-107publ228/pdf/PLAW-107publ228.pdf |title=Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 ~ P.L. 107-228 |date=September 30, 2002 |series=116 Stat. 1436 ~ House Bill 1646 |publisher=U.S. Government Printing Office}}</ref> The amendment authorized a four year extension for admission to the United States by eligible former Soviet Union and Baltic States scientists. The House 1646 bill heighten the 1992 [[Travel visa|visa]] provision from seven hundred and fifty to nine hundred and fifty for [[Eastern Bloc]] scientists possessing "exceptional ability in the sciences".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.congress.gov/bill/107th-congress/house-bill/1646 |title=H.R. 1646 ~ Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 |date=April 27, 2001 |series=P.L. 107-228 ~ 116 Stat. 1350 |publisher=Congress.gov}}</ref>

{{short description|One who transports oneself surrepticiously}} {{Other uses}} {{Multiple issues| {{lead too short|date=June 2015}} {{One source|date=September 2012}} }}
[[File:Astrakhan trams, 1041 stowaway.jpg|thumb|A stowaway on a tram in [[Astrakhan]], Russia]] [[File:Chinasmuggle lg.jpg|thumb|upright|A [[intermodal container|shipping container]] in which 22 stowaways were captured in the [[Port of Seattle]]]]
A '''stowaway''' is a person who secretly boards a [[vehicle]], such as a [[ship]], an [[fixed-wing aircraft|aircraft]], a [[train]], [[truck|cargo truck]] or [[bus]], in order to travel without paying and without being detected.
== Air travel == {{further|List of wheel-well stowaway flights}} Poor perimeter security at a number of airports around the world can make it easier for people to stow away on planes.<ref>{{cite web|title='He's a lost soul': mystery of man who fell to earth from plane|url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/hes-a-lost-soul-mystery-of-man-who-fell-to-earth-from-plane-20121211-2b6lq.html|work=AP|publisher=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=30 December 2012|date=11 December 2012}}</ref>
Stowaways in aircraft wheel wells face numerous health risks, many of which are fatal: being mangled when the [[Landing gear|undercarriage]] retracts, [[tinnitus]], [[deafness]], [[hypothermia]], [[Hypoxic hypoxia|hypoxia]], [[frostbite]], [[acidosis]] and finally falling when the doors of the compartment reopen.<ref name=BBC/> The landing gear compartment is not equipped with heating, pressure or oxygen, which are vital for survival at a high altitude.<ref name=BBC/> According to experts, at {{convert|18,000|ft|m}}, hypoxia causes [[lightheadedness]], weakness, [[vision impairment]] and [[tremor]]s. By {{convert|22,000|ft|m}} the oxygen level of the blood drops and the person will struggle to stay conscious.<ref name=BBC>{{cite news |title=How often do plane stowaways fall from the sky? |first=Jon |last=Kelly |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-19562101 |work=[[BBC News]] |date=September 13, 2012 |accessdate=September 13, 2012}}</ref> Above {{convert|33,000|ft|m}} their lungs would need artificial pressure to operate normally.<ref name=BBC/> The temperature could drop as low as {{convert|-63|°C|°F}} which causes severe hypothermia.<ref name=BBC/> Those stowaways who managed to not be crushed by the retracting undercarriage or killed by the deadly conditions would most likely be unconscious when the compartment door re-opens during the approach and fall several thousand feet to their deaths.<ref name=BBC/>
David Learmount, an aviation expert of [[Flight International]], told ''[[BBC News|BBC]]'' about a lot of ignorance in this area. He suggested that no one would be willing to risk such journey, having full understanding of this kind of ordeal.<ref name=BBC/> Stowaways who survived usually traveled relatively short distances or at a low altitude.<ref name=BBC/> Two cases are known of people who survived at an altitude of about {{convert|38,000|ft|m}} – a man on an 8-hour flight, whose body core temperature fell to {{convert|79|F|C}},<ref>{{citation|title=Stowaway Found Alive in Jet's Wheel Well|url=http://abcnews.go.com/m/story?id=96267}}</ref> and a 16-year-old boy who was unharmed by a 5.5 hour flight, despite losing consciousness.<ref>{{citation|title=16-year-old Survives in Wheel Well of Maui Flight|url=http://www.seattlepi.com/news/us/article/16-year-old-survives-in-wheel-well-of-Maui-flight-5416974.php}}</ref> Almost all aircraft stowaways are male.<ref name=BBC/>
In one reported case, in 2003, a young man mailed himself in a large box and had it shipped on [[United Parcel Service|UPS]] planes from New York City to Texas. He survived because the box travelled in a pressurized hold of an aircraft.<ref>{{citation|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2004/aug/30/usa.features11|title=The crate escape|first=Alex|last=Hannaford|periodical=The Guardian|date=29 August 2004}}</ref>
From 1947 until September 2012, there were 96 known stowaway attempts worldwide in wheel wells of 85 separate flights, which resulted in 73 deaths with only 23 survivors.<ref name=BBC/>
=== Security === Stowaways may risk being fined or imprisoned, since it is illegal in most jurisdictions to embark on aircraft, boats or trains as stowaways. [[Airport]]s, sea [[port]]s and [[train station]]s are typically marked as "no [[trespass]]ing" or "[[private property]]" zones to anyone but customers and employees. Seaports, train stations, and airports often attempt further security by designating restricted areas with signs saying "Authorized Personnel Only".
Since the [[September 11 attacks]], it has become more difficult to be a stowaway on board transportation arriving to or departing from the United States. Airport security has dramatically increased, and among the new security measures is trained professionals watching over the fences from which stowaways usually gain entrance to an airport's runway.
== Rail transportation == {{empty section|date=December 2012}} {{see also|Freighthopping|Hobo}}
Some illegal immigrants travel around Europe in trucks and trains without being detected. A number of them try to get to other European countries, such as France and the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2015/jul/31/calais-crisis-david-cameron-chairs-cobra-meeting-as-mod-role-discussed|title=Cameron chairs Cobra meeting after overnight standoff in Calais|first=Josh|last=Halliday|date=31 July 2015|publisher=|accessdate=2 June 2017|via=The Guardian}}</ref>
== Ship travel == Stowaways on sailing ships and on steamships made this way of illicit travel known throughout the world. Throughout the nineteenth and twentieth centuries impecunious (poor) would-be emigrants and travelers seeking adventure for no cost helped to make it seem romantic. Noted stowaways to America by steamship have included [[Henry Armetta]], [[Bruno Richard Hauptmann]], [[Willem de Kooning]] and [[Jan Valtin]].
=== Origin === The word takes its origin with the expression ''stow away''.
This ''stow away'' expression is old and was used for things (such as food), such usage is seen for instance in the 1699 book ''A New Voyage Round the World, Volume 1'' or 1647 ''Journals of the House of Lords, Volume 10''.
The word was also used (later) for people. This gave names such as ''stow-aways'', when the correct current name in modern English language is ''stowaway''.
Depending on the circumstances, people were stowed away in order to hide themselves, or to be transported as slaves.
The concept of people hiding is not so recent; it was yet forbidden (and so known) in 1748 by king of Spain, under the ''polizón'' denomination.
=== In United States ===
The US legislation set up a stowaway concept in 1850. Previously, entry on the territory was free.<ref name="Ancestry magazine janv.-févr. 2003"> https://books.google.com/books?id=W2cGYPC9j3EC& Ancestry magazine janv.-févr. 2003 </ref> and the ''stowaway'' word might be older.
In 1891, the new US legislation requires the boat to pay the return travel for people not admitted in US, even if stowaway were still admitted.<ref name="Ancestry magazine janv.-févr. 2003" />
474 stowaways arrived in US in fiscal year 1910,<ref name="Ancestry magazine janv.-févr. 2003" /> and 528, next year.
In 1917, a new legislation defines a list of excludable aliens including stowaways.<ref name="Ancestry magazine janv.-févr. 2003" />
Several stowaways arrived in United States by boat during the first half of twentieth century; they were paying for 25 to 30 dollars to travel.<ref> The Rotarian oct. 1921 https://books.google.com/books?id=gEYEAAAAMBAJ What about the immigrant? </ref>
Some stowaways were famous such as Hugh Todd.<ref> https://books.google.com/books?id=daKhAQAAQBAJ Social History of the Scotch-Irish / Carlton Jackson / Madison Books, 12 août 1999 - 224 pages </ref>
=== From 1843 === The Convention on Facilitation of International Maritime Traffic, 1965, as amended, (The FAL Convention), define stowaway as "A person who is secreted on a ship, or in cargo which is subsequently loaded on the ship, without the consent of the shipowner or the master or any other responsible person and who is detected on board the ship after it has departed from a port, or in the cargo while unloading it in the port of arrival, and is reported as a stowaway by the master to the appropriate authorities".
Unnoticed by the [[Sea captain|captain]], crew, port officials and customs authorities, stowaways may gain access to a ship with or without the assistance of port personnel. Once on board the ship, stowaways hide in empty containers, cargo holds, tanks, tunnels, behind false panels, stores, accommodation areas, engine rooms, void spaces, cranes and chain lockers.
The presence of stowaways on board ships may bring serious consequences for ships and, by extension, to the shipping industry as a whole; the ship could be delayed in port; the repatriation of stowaways can be a very complex and costly procedure involving masters, shipowners, port authorities and agents, and the life of stowaways could be endangered as they may spent several days hidden, with the risk of suffocation and without any food or water.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.imo.org/ourwork/facilitation/stowaways/Pages/Default.aspx |title=Stowaways |website=imo.org |publisher=[[International Maritime Organization]] |accessdate=February 8, 2015}}</ref>
